before classes had to be started the
hunting ground is a documentary about
rape and sexual assault on American
college campuses in her review Manohla
Dargis writes the hunting ground crams a
crowd of faces and one seemingly
unwieldy subject into a painful
absorbing if periodically cluttered
documentary the sit down with the
students ask them where the hotspots
face sexual assault expected its power
largely derives from the young women and
men recounting on camera how they were
raped at their schools and then
subsequently denied justice by those
same institutions they told me despite
the fact that I had a written admission
of guilt that I presented to them could
only prove that he loved me their
stories make this imperfect movie a
must-see work of cinna activism one that
should be seen by anyone headed to

writes if the Oscars have left you with
a residual hatred of Hollywood or a
renewed appreciation of julianne moore
maps to the stars may be just what you
